item.title: ADJECTIVES
item.description:

item.title: CONJUNCTIONS
item.description:
CONJUNCTIONS

Compounds

Enclitics

Meaning

adversative

appositional indicator [wJ"]

conditional [eij, eja;n]

conjunctive

illative

co-ordinating [h[, gavr]

subordinating [ejpeiv]

Paired conjunctions [ἤ. . . ἤ; καί . . . καί; τέ . . καί; τέ . . . τέ; μέν . . . δέ; οὐ μόνον . . . ἀλλά; καί]

Phrase conjunctions [εἰ μή]

Postpositives

Root [See Metzger Lex Aids 49; Trenchard Voc Guide 5]

item.title: INTERJECTIONS
item.description:
INTERJECTIONS

ἄγε, James 4:13

ἴδε, John 1:29

δεῦρο, Mark 10:21

ἰδού, Matthew 11:10 absolutely; Revelation 4:1 (with article)

ἔα, Luke 4:34

οὐά, Mark 15:29 (with vocative)

οὐαί, Luke 6:25 (with vocative);

used absolutely οὐαί οὐαί (Ρεωελατιον 18:10, 16, 19

used with the dative as in Matthew 11:21; Luke 6:24-25

ὦ, with the vocative in Matthew 15:28

ὡς exclamatory particle in Romans 10:15

τί exclamatory particle in Lk. 12:49

Α. Τ. Robertson, A Grammar of the Greek New Testament in the Light of Historical Research, Broadman Press, 1934. 4th ed.

item.title: PARTICLES
item.description:
PARTICLES

(“Particles” is a loose category that is not uniformly defined among Greek scholars. Some include in particles everything but nouns, pronouns, and verbs (A. T. Robertson); other include only the intensifying short words; many include prepositions, conjunctions, negatives, and modal adverbs.)

Enclitics [gev, a[n, mevn, pevr, rJav]

Postpositive [dhv, gev, mevn, pevr, toiv]

Non-enclitic particles [[a[ra, toigavr (toiv + ge + a[ra) toinu’n, nhv, naiv, ei| mhvn, ouj, mhv, mh; ouj]

item.title: PREPOSITIONS
item.description:
PREPOSITIONS

Appositional indicator [wJ"]

Case Governance

governing 1 case

G

D

A

governing 2 cases: genitive, accusative

governing 3 cases: genitive, dative, accusative

with movables

eliding weak final vowels (before words with initial vowel or before roots with initial vowel) (See Trenchard’s Voc. Guide, 290)

Contract verbs

ε-contract

ο-contract

Enclitics

Governance

genitive [`a{ptomai]

dative [ajkolouqevw]

accusative

accusatives, capable of governing two, that are object + objective complement [= verbs able to be followed by a nominative in passive transforms] [euJrivskw, tivqhmi, kalevw, ojnomavzw, levgw]
